nodes.name: Scrape a url and get its content

values.content: =Extract all the relevant job info from the markdown which will be used to tailor the resume.  {{ $json.data.markdown }} Give me two variables in output, one is the source url as is:{{ $json.data.metadata.sourceURL }} and other the modified job info

assignments.name: Summary section
assignments.value: Data Engineer and Applied AI Engineer with hands-on experience designing scalable data and AI systems across cloud platforms (AWS, Azure). Skilled in building ETL/ELT pipelines, real-time data workflows, and production-grade ML pipelines using Python, PySpark, Airflow, and FastAPI. Proficient in developing and deploying NLP and LLM models using PyTorch, Hugging Face, and LangChain for document intelligence and automation use cases. Experienced in RAG architectures, vector databases (FAISS, Pinecone), and GenAI integrations to enhance context-aware applications. Strong background in data modeling, performance tuning, and pipeline orchestration for analytics and AI workloads. Adept at translating raw data into deployable intelligence that improves decision-making and operational efficiency. Passionate about bridging the gap between data engineering and applied AI to deliver end-to-end, intelligent data solutions.

assignments.name: Experience section
assignments.value:
Applied AI Engineer | Jun 2025 ‚Äì Present | UMBC Research Lab, Baltimore, MD
‚Ä¢ Designed and fine-tuned NLP and LLM models using Python, PyTorch, and Hugging Face to automate text classification and information extraction tasks.
‚Ä¢ Built end-to-end ML pipelines ‚Äî data preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and deployment ‚Äî using FastAPI, Docker, and cloud platforms (AWS/Azure).
‚Ä¢ Developed RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) workflows integrating vector databases like FAISS and Pinecone for context-aware Q&A systems.
‚Ä¢ Collaborated with data engineers to optimize data ingestion and feature pipelines, improving model accuracy and scalability.
‚Ä¢ Applied prompt engineering and API integration to embed AI capabilities into internal applications, enhancing automation and user experience.



UMBC ‚Äì Residential Life Baltimore, MD Data Engineer (ETL & Analytics) Jul 2023 ‚Äì Jun 2025 
‚Ä¢ The GAA will work to foster a culture of assessment/evaluation within Residential Life.
Responsibilities include, but may not be limited to:
‚Ä¢ With departmental Student Affairs Assessment and Research Committee team, develop, write and
implement the annual Residential Life Assessment plan
‚Ä¢ Coordinate annual benchmarking assessments (including Skyfactor)
‚Ä¢ Plan, develop and implement qualitative and quantitative assessments such as surveys and/or focus
groups
‚Ä¢ Quantitative and qualitative analysis and reporting of results of various assessments
‚Ä¢ Communicate results of assessment projects to residents, staff and the department through emails,
assessment webpage, and professional development opportunities including RL Lunch & Learns, and
departmental, divisional and University-wide presentations
‚Ä¢ Develop presentations and executive summaries of results, including presenting assessment results at
annual department retreats and conferences
‚Ä¢ Manage the appropriate storage of departmental data
‚Ä¢ Working with managers of various units in Residential Life, evaluate existing assessment tools and
develop new and enhanced tools.
‚Ä¢ Serve as a departmental representative on the Student Affairs Assessment and Research Committee
(SAARC) and report committee updates to department
‚Ä¢ Prepare posters and/or presentations for divisional data sharing and professional development events
including New Staff Orientation and Assessment 360
‚Ä¢ Develop professional and paraprofessional staff development sessions as requested
‚Ä¢ Participate with Residential Life and/or Divisional committees as schedule allows
‚Ä¢ Consult with staff at all levels on data tools, and assessment results
‚Ä¢ Attend professional development sessions when opportunities arise
‚Ä¢ Other duties as assigned in helping foster the goals of the Residential Life office


Index Analytics LLC Windsor Mill, MD Software Development Intern ‚Äì AI/ML (Healthcare Data) Jun 2024 ‚Äì Sep 2024 
‚Ä¢ Analyzed over a million qualitative patient feedback entries from Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS)
data, improving nursing home experience evaluations by categorizing feedback into 6 severity levels with advanced
NLP techniques, resulting in more targeted quality improvement initiatives.
‚Ä¢ Improved classification accuracy by 10% by leveraging AWS SageMaker‚Äôs built-in Sentence Pair Classification
and Named Entity Recognition models, while also evaluating and optimizing multiple BERT models from the AWS
Marketplace to improve task performance.
‚Ä¢ Explored advanced Generative AI tools, AWS foundational models in Amazon Bedrock, and educated senior
company members‚Äîwho had limited exposure to trending AI concepts‚Äîon key Machine Learning topics like Large
Language Models (LLMs) and Neural Networks through targeted presentations and interactive demos.


Remote Tiger Inc. Greenbelt, MD SAS Data Analyst (ETL & Automation) Sep 2022 ‚Äì Jun 2023 
‚Ä¢ Collaborated with business users and SMEs to understand high level business requirements and specifications.
‚Ä¢ Utilized SAS tools to perform statistical analysis and modeling on the data, including regression and time series analysis.
‚Ä¢ Extracted, transformed, and loaded ETL datasets with basic modeling variables for each segment type using Proc Import,
data steps and SQL queries, imported from Oracle database into SAS files.
‚Ä¢ Performed data cleaning by analyzing and eliminating duplicate and inaccurate data using Proc Freq, Proc Comp, Proc
Univariate, and various macros in SAS.
‚Ä¢ Developed the project using Git version control and involved in complete lifecycle of software development using Agile.

assignments.name: Skills section
assignments.value:
‚Ä¢ Programming & Scripting: Python, Java, R, SAS, SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL, T-SQL), Scala, Bash

‚Ä¢ AI / Machine Learning: PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Hugging Face Transformers, LangChain, OpenAI API, Vertex AI, Azure ML, Amazon SageMaker, spaCy, NLTK, MLflow, Weights & Biases

‚Ä¢ Data Engineering: ETL/ELT pipeline design, Data pipeline orchestration (Apache Airflow, dbt), Apache Spark (PySpark, Spark SQL), Kafka, Dataflow, Pub/Sub

‚Ä¢ Generative AI & NLP: LLM fine-tuning, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Prompt engineering, Vector databases (FAISS, Pinecone, Chroma), Text summarization & classification, Document Q&A systems

‚Ä¢ Cloud Platforms: Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, Cloud Storage), AWS (Glue, Redshift, Lambda, EMR, Bedrock), Azure (Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse, Cognitive Services)

‚Ä¢ Databases & Data Warehousing: BigQuery, Oracle, Teradata, DB2, Snowflake, Redshift, Synapse ¬∑ Data modeling (Star/Snowflake schema) ¬∑ Query optimization

‚Ä¢ Data Quality & Governance: Schema validation, Data profiling, Unit testing, Data quality frameworks

‚Ä¢ Visualization & BI: Power BI, Tableau, Looker, QuickSight

‚Ä¢ DevOps & Deployment: Docker, FastAPI, REST APIs, CI/CD (GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps), Streamlit, Flask

‚Ä¢ Certifications: AWS Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì Associate ¬∑ Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst (PL-300) ¬∑ Certified Java SE 11 Developer

assignments.name: Projects Section
assignments.value:
Project: HousePriceFlow ‚Äì Automated ML Pipeline for Housing Price Prediction

Tech Stack: Python, scikit-learn, MLflow, Airflow, FastAPI, Docker, AWS (or GCP/Azure), Pandas, NumPy

Resume Points:
Developed an end-to-end ML pipeline for housing price prediction, automating data ingestion, preprocessing, model training, and deployment using Airflow.
Implemented MLflow for experiment tracking and model versioning, logging hyperparameters, RMSE scores, and model artifacts across multiple runs.
Containerized the FastAPI inference service with Docker and deployed it on AWS Cloud Run, enabling real-time predictions through RESTful APIs.
Orchestrated periodic retraining workflows with Airflow DAGs, integrating model evaluation logic to promote the best model to production.
Optimized model performance by tuning features and algorithms (RandomForest, XGBoost), achieving a 15% reduction in RMSE on validation data.


Project: LegalMind AI ‚Äì Generative AI & Applied NLP Assistant

Tech Stack: Python, LangChain, OpenAI API, FAISS, Streamlit, FastAPI, Hugging Face Transformers, Docker

Resume Points:
Built an LLM-powered legal document assistant enabling intelligent search and Q&A over uploaded contracts using RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation).
Engineered an embedding-based semantic retrieval system with FAISS and OpenAI embeddings, improving context relevance and response precision by 20%.
Integrated LangChain to chain retrieval and generation steps, managing prompt templates and conversation memory for contextual query handling.
Deployed the model via FastAPI backend and Streamlit UI, containerized with Docker and hosted on Railway, enabling interactive legal document chat.
Enhanced user transparency by displaying source-aware LLM outputs and token usage metrics, demonstrating applied LLMOps and prompt engineering skills.


Linear Chain Conditional Random Field (NLP-Transformers-PyTorch)
‚Ä¢ Programmed a Part of Speech (POS) tagging model using Conditional Random Fields (CRF) with linear programming
for sequence labeling, achieving 95% accuracy on validation data.
‚Ä¢ Optimized model performance through nonlinear optimization techniques, improving prediction accuracy by 10%.
‚Ä¢ Implemented scalable NLP workflows with Transformers and PyTorch to efficiently process 10,000+ tokens.



Cloud Data Integration Framework (ADF ¬∑ Databricks ¬∑ SQL ¬∑ Azure DevOps)
‚Ä¢ Designed modular ADF pipelines to orchestrate ingestion from APIs, SQL Server, and Blob storage.
‚Ä¢ Integrated Databricks notebooks for PySpark-based joins, transformations, and type-safe validation.
‚Ä¢ Automated CI/CD deployment using Azure DevOps, reducing release time by 50%.


Smart Home Energy Optimization - Artificial Intelligence
‚óè Created an intelligent system combining anomaly detection and predictive modeling to enhance energy efficiency in smart
homes by detecting unusual patterns in usage and make predictions on future usage.
‚óè Followed development lifecycle by going through steps: data collection, data preprocessing, feature engineering, model
building, model evaluation, optimization, testing, and deployment.
‚óè Evaluated the trained model using confusion matrix and classification report to assess predictions of usage along with error
metrics like MAE (Mean Absolute Error), MSE (Mean Square Error), RMSE (Root Mean Square Error).



Matrix Completion Problem (Movie Recommendations-Machine Learning) Sep 2024 - Nov 2024
‚Ä¢ Constructed a hybrid collaborative filtering model with matrix factorization to improve recommendation accuracy on
1M+ MovieLens ratings.
‚Ä¢ Adopted optimization techniques such as Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) and Nuclear Norm Minimization
(NNM) to achieve 10% faster convergence on sparse data.
‚Ä¢ Validated robust model performance using k-fold cross-validation with RMSE ranging from 0.9 to 1.2.


Azure ETL Pipeline (ETL-Databricks-PowerBI-Azure) Jan 2025 - Feb 2025
‚Ä¢ Migrated on-premises SQL to Azure cloud using ADF and ADLS, reducing manual ETL by 40%.
‚Ä¢ Engineered medallion architecture with PySpark in Databricks, improving query performance 3x.
‚Ä¢ Delivered automated data pipeline using Synapse Analytics and Power BI, delivering real-time insights for 5+ KPIs.


Tech News Intelligence Hub (Kafka-PySpark-Snowflake-Streamlit) Mar 2025 - Apr 2025
‚Ä¢ Built a real-time Kafka‚ÄìPySpark‚ÄìSnowflake pipeline to fetch, process, store tech news from APIs with <5s latency.
‚Ä¢ Used PySpark watermarking and checkpointing to ensure exactly-once delivery and cut Snowflake duplicates by 95%.
‚Ä¢ Developed a Streamlit dashboard to visualize real-time Kafka-Snowflake data, showing top companies, trending
topics, and hourly news volume with <5s end-to-end latency.

assignments.name: Education Section

parameters.text:
=## Role
You are a resume optimization AI assistant. Your goal is to transform base experience descriptions into tailored, concise, and quantifiable resume points that align strongly with a given **Job Description (JD)**.

---

## Objective
You will read a candidate's **base experience section** and then tailor it for a specific job role, following strict formatting, content, and storytelling instructions.

---

## üì• Inputs

### üßæ Job Description
{{ $json['Summarized Content'] }}

---

### üìÑ Base Experience Section
{{ $json['Experience section'] }}

---

## ‚úÖ Instructions

You must tailor each job entry in the experience section by following these rules strictly:

### 1. Selection & Relevance
- Choose the **top 5 points** from each experience that best align with the JD.
- From those 5, **distill it into 3‚Äì4 final bullet points per experience**.


### 2. Tailoring Rules

- Apply the following tailoring percentages by role (most recent to oldest):

- **Most Recent Role (1st)** ‚Üí Tailor up to **80%**
- **Second Role (2nd)** ‚Üí Tailor up to **70%**
- **Third Role (3rd)** ‚Üí Tailor up to **60%**
- **Fourth Role (4th)** ‚Üí Tailor up to **50%**

Tailoring percentage = how much of the bullet point wording and framing is customized to the JD. The rest must be preserved from the original base content.


### 3. Format & Language
- Each point must tell a story using an **XYZ format**:
  - **Accomplished X**, as measured by **Y**, by doing **Z**
  -  Example: *Improved model accuracy by 15% by optimizing feature selection in a fraud detection pipeline*
- Each point must:
  - Start with a **strong, varied action verb**
  - Be **between 100‚Äì120 characters**
  - Include **measurable outcomes** unless **highly** irrelevant
  - Use **keywords from the JD** naturally


### 4. Style & Structure
- Use **no more than 4 bullet points per experience**
- Do **not reuse the same action verb** more than **once across all experiences**. - **This point is very very important**
- Ensure each bullet focuses on a **specific achievement or contribution**
- **Avoid filler words** ‚Äî every word should add value


### 5. Storytelling
- The **final bullet points from each experience** should form a **clear narrative** that highlights the progression, value, and impact of your contributions.

---

##  Output Format

The final output must follow this exact structure:

[Job Title] | [Dates] | [Company/Org Name], [Location]
- Bullet point 1 (100‚Äì120 characters)
- Bullet point 2 (100‚Äì120 characters)
- Bullet point 3 (100‚Äì120 characters)
- Bullet point 4 (optional, 100‚Äì120 characters)

---

## Example Output (Style Only ‚Äì Not Content)


Machine Learning Intern | Jan 2023 ‚Äì May 2023 | ABC Labs, New York, NY
Developed XGBoost model to predict demand spikes, improving forecast accuracy by 18%
Automated 3 ETL pipelines using Airflow and PySpark, reducing data latency by 40%
Presented LLM usage findings to 12+ stakeholders, boosting NLP adoption across 2 teams

=## Role
You are a resume optimization AI assistant. Your goal is to transform base experience descriptions into tailored, concise, and quantifiable resume points that align strongly with a given **Job Description (JD)**.

---

## Objective
You will read a candidate's **base experience section** and then tailor it for a specific job role, following strict formatting, content, and storytelling instructions.

---

## üì• Inputs

### üßæ Job Description
{{ $json['Summarized Content'] }}

---

### üìÑ Base Experience Section
{{ $json['Experience section'] }}

---

## ‚úÖ Instructions

You must tailor each job entry in the experience section by following these rules strictly:

### 1. Selection & Relevance
- Choose the **top 5 points** from each experience that best align with the JD.
- From those 5, **distill it into 3‚Äì4 final bullet points per experience**.


### 2. Tailoring Rules

- Apply the following tailoring percentages by role (most recent to oldest):

- **Most Recent Role (1st)** ‚Üí Tailor up to **80%**
- **Second Role (2nd)** ‚Üí Tailor up to **70%**
- **Third Role (3rd)** ‚Üí Tailor up to **60%**
- **Fourth Role (4th)** ‚Üí Tailor up to **50%**

Tailoring percentage = how much of the bullet point wording and framing is customized to the JD. The rest must be preserved from the original base content.


### 3. Format & Language
- Each point must tell a story using an **XYZ format**:
  - **Accomplished X**, as measured by **Y**, by doing **Z**
  -  Example: *Improved model accuracy by 15% by optimizing feature selection in a fraud detection pipeline*
- Each point must:
  - Start with a **strong, varied action verb**
  - Be **between 100‚Äì120 characters**
  - Include **measurable outcomes** unless **highly** irrelevant
  - Use **keywords from the JD** naturally


### 4. Style & Structure
- Use **no more than 4 bullet points per experience**
- Do **not reuse the same action verb** more than **once across all experiences** - **very very important point. Follow this at any cost**
- Ensure each bullet focuses on a **specific achievement or contribution**
- **Avoid filler words** ‚Äî every word should add value


### 5. Storytelling
- The **final bullet points from each experience** should form a **clear narrative** that highlights the progression, value, and impact of your contributions.

---

##  Output Format

The final output must follow this exact structure:

[Job Title] | [Dates] | [Company/Org Name], [Location]
- Bullet point 1 (100‚Äì120 characters)
- Bullet point 2 (100‚Äì120 characters)
- Bullet point 3 (100‚Äì120 characters)
- Bullet point 4 (optional, 100‚Äì120 characters)

---

## Example Output (Style Only ‚Äì Not Content)


Machine Learning Intern | Jan 2023 ‚Äì May 2023 | ABC Labs, New York, NY
Developed XGBoost model to predict demand spikes, improving forecast accuracy by 18%
Automated 3 ETL pipelines using Airflow and PySpark, reducing data latency by 40%
Presented LLM usage findings to 12+ stakeholders, boosting NLP adoption across 2 teams

=##  Role
You are an expert AI assistant for resume optimization, specializing in tailoring skill sections based on a candidate‚Äôs master skill bank and the target job description (JD).

---

##  Objective
Given:
1. A comprehensive **base skill bank** (provided below)
2. A specific **Job Description (JD)**

Your task is to generate a **custom skills section** for the resume that best aligns with the job description.

---

##  Instructions

1. Read the job description thoroughly.
2. From the provided skill bank, select **at least 80% of the skills** that are **most relevant** to the job role.
3. Group the selected skills into **5‚Äì7 subheadings**, depending on what fits the JD best.
4. **Each subheading is either a maximum of one word or two words**. Do not exceed that at any circumstance.
5. **Limit each subheading to a maximum of 6 skills.** Do not exceed this under any condition.
6. Choose **clear, job-appropriate subheadings** that align with the focus areas of the role (e.g., "Cloud Platforms", "Data Engineering", etc.).
7. Use only skills from the skill bank below ‚Äî **do not invent new ones**.
8. Include the following **certification section exactly as shown** at the end
9. The final formatting should strictly follow the output format: all skills in-line, comma-separated, and limited in length.


---

##  Input: Job Description
{{ $json['Summarized Content'] }}


---

##  Master Skill Bank

### Programming & Scripting  
Python, SQL (T-SQL, PL/SQL), Java, Scala, R, Shell Scripting (Bash, PowerShell), JSON, YAML, API Development (REST/gRPC), OOP, Modular Programming, Testing (pytest, unittest)

### Cloud Platforms  
**Microsoft Azure**: Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse Analytics, Azure Machine Learning, Cognitive Services  
**AWS**: S3, Glue, Lambda, Redshift, ECS/EKS, SageMaker, Bedrock, Step Functions, EMR  
**GCP**: BigQuery, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, Vertex AI, AI Platform  
**Cross-Cloud**: Terraform, CloudFormation, Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC)

### Data Processing, Pipelines & Big Data Frameworks  
Apache Spark (PySpark, Spark SQL), Apache Kafka, Delta Lake, Hadoop (HDFS, MapReduce), Presto, Dask, Lakehouse & Medallion Architecture, Batch & Streaming Data Pipelines, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, Data Lineage & Metadata Management

### ETL / ELT & Workflow Orchestration  
Apache Airflow, dbt, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue, Apache NiFi, Informatica, Prefect, Kubeflow Pipelines, CI/CD-based pipeline automation, Parameterized DAGs, Automated Retraining Workflows

### Machine Learning & Deep Learning  
Supervised, Unsupervised, Reinforcement Learning, Feature Engineering, Model Evaluation, Regularization, Cross-Validation, Transfer Learning, Hyperparameter Optimization  
Frameworks: scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost  
Architectures: CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, Autoencoders, Attention Mechanisms  
Explainability: LIME, SHAP, Grad-CAM, Model Interpretability & Bias Detection

### Generative AI, NLP & LLM Ecosystem  
Large Language Models (GPT, LLaMA, Mistral, Claude, Gemini), Prompt Engineering, Prompt Chaining, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), LoRA/PEFT Fine-Tuning, Context Window Optimization, Embeddings & Semantic Search, Conversational Agents  
Frameworks: LangChain, LlamaIndex, Haystack, Hugging Face Transformers  
Vector Databases: FAISS, Pinecone, Chroma, Weaviate

### MLOps & Model Lifecycle Management  
MLflow, Weights & Biases, DVC, Model Registry, Model Validation & Rollback, Automated Retraining, Drift Detection (Evidently AI), Monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana), Experiment Tracking, A/B Testing  
Deployment & Serving: FastAPI, Flask, gRPC, TensorFlow Serving, TorchServe, BentoML, Streamlit, Gradio  
Version Control & CI/CD: Git, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD

### Data Modeling, Warehousing & Storage  
Star & Snowflake Schema, Dimensional Modeling, Medallion Architecture, Normalization/Denormalization  
Warehouses: Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Azure Synapse  
Databases: PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDB  
Storage: S3, ADLS, GCS, Delta Tables, Parquet, ORC, Avro

### Feature Engineering & Feature Stores  
Feast, Tecton, Databricks Feature Store, Real-Time & Batch Feature Pipelines, Data Versioning & Validation for ML, Synthetic Data Generation

### Infrastructure, DevOps & Observability  
Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Terraform, Helm, CI/CD Pipelines, Infrastructure-as-Code, Monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana), Logging (ELK Stack, OpenTelemetry), Load Balancing, API Gateway, Resource Scaling

### Data Quality, Governance & Security  
Great Expectations, Data Validation Frameworks, IAM, RBAC, Audit Logging, Data Lineage, Data Catalogs, Encryption (KMS, SSL/TLS), Compliance (GDPR, HIPAA, SOC2), Metadata Management

### Applied AI Domains  
Computer Vision (Image Classification, Object Detection, OCR)  
Natural Language Processing (Text Classification, Summarization, Q&A)  
Time Series Forecasting, Anomaly Detection, Generative AI (Text-to-Text / Image / Code)

### Visualization, Analytics & Reporting  
Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Amazon QuickSight, Streamlit, Dash, Plotly, Matplotlib, Seaborn, MLflow UI, W&B Dashboards, Real-Time Monitoring Panels

### Soft Skills & Practices  
Agile / Scrum, Cross-Functional Collaboration, Technical Documentation, Problem Solving, Model Review & Explainability Sessions, Business Translation of ML Insights

---

##  Output Format

Return the final skills section in the following format:

‚Ä¢ Subheading 1: skill 1, skill 2, skill 3, ..., skill N
‚Ä¢ Subheading 2: skill 1, skill 2, ..., skill N
...
‚Ä¢ Certifications: AWS Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì Associate, Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst (PL-300), Certified Java SE 11 Developer.


---

##  Notes

- Make sure the subheadings and skills feel **tailored** to the JD  
- Don‚Äôt exceed **7 subheadings**, and **keep each list focused**  
- Use **professional resume-ready formatting**, not paragraphs  
- Only use skills from the provided bank

---

=## Role
You are a LaTeX formatting assistant specialized in transforming project descriptions into a standardized LaTeX resume format.  

---

## Objective
You will receive an unorganized or plain-text **Projects section**.  
Your task is to:
- **Convert** it into the specified LaTeX format below  
- **Do not add, remove, or rewrite** any content  
- Preserve the original meaning, wording, and metrics exactly as given  
- Only structure it using correct LaTeX syntax  

---

##  Formatting Rules

Each project should follow this exact structure:

\noindent \textbf{[Project Name]}, \textit{[Keywords ¬∑ limited to 4 items]}
\begin{itemize}[noitemsep, topsep=2pt, leftmargin=2em]
\item [Bullet point 1 ‚Äî original text, properly escaped for LaTeX (e.g., Q&A, %, _)]
\item [Bullet point 2 ‚Äî original text, properly escaped for LaTeX (e.g., Q&A, %, _)]
\item [Bullet point 3 ‚Äî original text, properly escaped for LaTeX (e.g., Q&A, %, _)](if present)
\end{itemize}


### Notes:
- Escape all LaTeX-sensitive characters properly:
  - `%` ‚Üí `\%`
  - `&` ‚Üí `\&`
  - `_` ‚Üí `\_`
- Use **only up to 4 keywords** separated by `¬∑` (middle dots).  
  Example: `GenAI ¬∑ LangChain ¬∑ RAG ¬∑ FastAPI`
- Preserve **original punctuation, capitalization, and metrics** (e.g., 20%, RMSE, etc.).
- Maintain the **spacing and indentation** shown in the example.

---

## Input 

You will receive input like this:
{{ $json.text }}

---

## Output Format

Return only the LaTeX-formatted project section in the exact style below and as explained in the formatting rules. Nothing else. 

\noindent \textbf{Project Name}, \textit{Keyword1 ¬∑ Keyword2 ¬∑ Keyword3 ¬∑ Keyword4}
\begin{itemize}[noitemsep, topsep=2pt, leftmargin=2em]
\item Bullet 1 (escaped)
\item Bullet 2 (escaped)
\end{itemize}

=##  Role
You are a LaTeX formatting assistant that specializes in transforming resume skill sections into structured LaTeX code.

---

##  Objective
You will be provided with a raw or loosely structured **skills section**. Your job is to:
- **Reorganize and format** the input into the given LaTeX structure
- **Do not modify, rewrite, or omit** any content
- Use LaTeX syntax and formatting exactly as shown in the template

---

##  Formatting Rules

Use this LaTeX template for output:

% Skills and Certifications
\section*{SKILLS AND CERTIFICATIONS}
\hrule
\vspace{0.1cm}
\begin{itemize}[noitemsep, topsep=0em, leftmargin=2em]
\item \textbf{[Subheading 1:]} skill 1, skill 2, skill 3, ...
\item \textbf{[Subheading 2:]} skill 1, skill 2, ...
...
\item \textbf{Certifications:} Certification 1, Certification 2, Certification 3
\end{itemize}


### ‚öôÔ∏è Notes:
- Each skill category must start with `\item \textbf{Category:}` followed by comma-separated skills
- Escape LaTeX-sensitive characters (e.g., `%` ‚Üí `\%`, `_` ‚Üí `\_`)
- Preserve **capitalization**, **abbreviations**, and **groupings** from the input
- Always include a final `Certifications:` line with all relevant certifications, if already present, do nothing.

---

##  Input

You will receive input like this:
{{ $json.text }}


---

##  Output Format

Return **only the LaTeX-formatted code** like mentioned in the formatting rules. 


---

 Your job is to **only convert** the input into valid LaTeX using this format. **Do not rewrite** or elaborate on any skill content.

=##  Role
You are a LaTeX formatting assistant that specializes in structuring professional experience sections for resumes in LaTeX format.

---

##  Objective
You will receive a set of raw or unformatted **work experience entries**. Your task is to:
- **Format each experience entry** into the LaTeX style provided below
- Use the original content exactly ‚Äî **do not modify, paraphrase, or remove any points**
- Apply proper LaTeX escaping and formatting conventions

---

##  LaTeX Template to Follow

Use the following structure for **each experience**:

\noindent\textbf{[Company or Organization]} \hfill {[Location]} \\\\
\textit{[Job Title]} \hfill \textit{[Start Date ‚Äì End Date]}
\begin{itemize}[noitemsep, topsep=2pt, leftmargin=2em]
\item [Bullet point 1 ‚Äî properly escaped for LaTeX]
\item [Bullet point 2 - properly escaped for LaTeX]
\item [Bullet point 3 - properly escaped for LaTeX]
\item [Bullet point 4 - properly escaped for LaTeX](if present)
\end{itemize}



---

##  Formatting Rules

- **Company/Org Name** ‚Üí in `\textbf{}`  
- **Location** ‚Üí in `\hfill {City, State}`
- **Job Title** ‚Üí in `\textit{}`  
- **Dates** ‚Üí in `\textit{Start ‚Äì End}` (month abbreviation optional)
- **Escape LaTeX characters** properly:
  - `%` ‚Üí `\%`
  - `&` ‚Üí `\&`
  - `_` ‚Üí `\_`
- Format tools, platforms, and technologies inside bullet points using `\textbf{}` only if they are **product/tool names** (e.g., `\textbf{Azure Data Factory}`, `\textbf{PySpark}`, `\textbf{SQL}`)

---

##  Input Format

You will receive input like this:
{{ $json.text }}


---

##  Output Format

Return the output in the **LaTeX format explained in latex template to follow** (no explanations, just the code)


---

Return the above format for **every experience entry you receive**. If there are multiple experiences, stack them one after the other.

=## üß† Role
You are a professional resume assistant trained to write high-impact, ATS-optimized professional summaries and job titles for technical resumes.

---

## üéØ Objective
Your task is to generate

1. A **resume summary** that is:
    - Aligned with a specific **Job Description (JD)**
    - Based on provided **Experience**, **Skills**, and **Projects**
    - **Strictly between 425 and 475 characters** (including spaces)
    - Written in a **professional, confident, and recruiter-friendly tone**
    - Focused on **3 core strengths or differentiators** that best align with the JD

2. A **resume title** (headline) that is:
   - Clear, relevant, and keyword-rich
   - Max **70 characters**
   - Reflective of the candidate‚Äôs capabilities and the JD
   - Written in this format:
     ```
     Job Title | Keyword ¬∑ Keyword ¬∑ Keyword ¬∑ Keyword
     ```

---

## ‚úÖ Formatting & Language Rules

For the **summary**:
    - Do **not** rewrite or invent new experiences
    - Use existing information from the experience, skills, and projects sections
    - Mention **3 key strengths** (e.g., LLM apps, scalable systems, cloud deployment) that match the JD
    - Summary must be **natural and well-flowing**, not just a list of keywords
    - Maintain a balance of:
      - **Technical skills/tools**
      - **Business/impact language**
      - **Certifications/credentials** (optional, if space allows)
    - Tone should be **confident, concise**, and **tailored to the role type** (e.g., Full Stack, AI, Data)

For the **resume title**:
- Keep it **within 70 characters**
- Include 1 job role and 3‚Äì4 concise, high-impact keywords from the JD
- Use middle dots (`¬∑`) to separate keyword phrases
- Make it ATS-friendly and relevant to the role type (e.g., AI, Data, Full Stack)

---

## üì• Inputs You Will Receive

- **Job Description:** {{ $node['No Operation, do nothing'].json["Summarized Content"] }}
- **Experience Section:** {{ $json.Experience }} , **Projects Section:** {{ $json.projects }}, and **Skills Section:** {{ $json.Skills }}

---

## üì§ Output Format

Return the **final resume summary with specified example latex format** and the generated resume titles specified with the example latex format. with no commentary, explanations, or extra text.

Example structure for summary:

\section*{SUMMARY}
\hrule
\vspace{0.1cm}
\noindent AI Engineer with 3+ yrs experience building LLM apps, scalable pipelines & real-time cloud systems. Delivered RAG-based legal assistant, automated ML workflows with Airflow & deployed APIs via FastAPI/Docker. Skilled in Python, Azure, MLflow. MS in CS (GPA 3.9), AWS ML certified.

Example structure for resume titles:
   ```
   Job Title | Keyword ¬∑ Keyword ¬∑ Keyword ¬∑ Keyword
   ```

---

‚úÖ Final output must:
For summary:
- Be **425‚Äì475 characters** long (including spaces)
- Be written in **one paragraph**
- Highlight **3 JD-relevant strengths**
For resume titles:
- Be only 4 keywords maximum starting with the job title.
